content.description:
The first 5 pitches are an enjoyable outing at 5.8-10b. 

From CAD Climber's Camp drive to mile 35.5 of the Goat Lake Main. Pull over on left side of the road locate the trail marked by pink flagger right beside the monstrous offwidth on the "Weenite Roaster" boulder.
SR-6, 2-60m ropes

Beautiful hand crack with a pumpy finish takes you to a nice ledge, from there you can continue up the stem corner (may require a wire brush) or go left for some YSF face climbing.



Head up the YSF trail for 15-20 min. The climb is before the first fixed rope, one of the few splitter hand cracks on the wall cant be missed. 

single rack to 3" + 2 bolts

After climbing the first pitch of Beautiful Nightmare bust left onto the face and prepare for 35m of sustained technical rock climbing, there are a few knee bars to de-pump along the way... if you can find them.

Once at the top you will have a few options you can take the route on the right (Off Grid) or the route on the left (Vulgar Display of Power).

To decend there are two 35m rappels straight down from top of Goodacre.



Alternative second pitch to Beautiful Nightmare. Also used to access Vulgar Display of Power and Off Grid above 

15 bolts

Climb a thin face just left of an overhanging arete to a ledge, then do an unassuming roof sequence followed by some spicy crimping up above. Very Fun!!



on the YSF slabs between Mommas Buns and Pretty Boys

bolts

Climbs sustained dead vertical scoopy chicken head patina. It’s most probably unlike any granite you’ve seen before. 10/10 divine!! P1 - 5.11b P2 - 5.11b P3 - 5.11c In summer, this route stays dry during rain Head to YSF (Younger. Stronger. Fitter.) wall on the left side of the West Main Buttress. Once at the base of YSF, walk up and left through the trees until you exit on to the slabs. Hand over hand the fixed line past pitons until you reach the base of Momma’s Buns. Theres a bolt to clip in to on the slab for the belayer.

~15-25 minute hike up, making it one of the shortest approaches in the valley! bolts.

12 draws will be enough Rappel the route.
60m rope

Climb awesome vertical granite past 8 bolt, avoid getting sucked left its easier (and safer) to commit to the steeper face on the right. After clipping your last bolt make strenuous moves to get established in the crack then punch it to the ledge above. 



Climb Beautiful Nightmare into The Good Acre, from there take the right bolt line into the corner crack.

8 bolts + single rack to 4"

climbs.name: Pretty Boys Get Their Ciggies Lit

content.description:
Clip the first bolt off jugs then do a fun slab move to gain the first ledge under the roof. There are two ways to do the roof: If you have small fingers go left, if you have big biceps go right. After the roof, hang out on the second ledge until you feel ready to pull the boulder problem. Continue from there up to the Zinc Sink ledge. Really good.



just after mile 35 there is a YSF sign marking the trailhead to the wall, follow for 15-25 min until you reach the slabs on the left side of the wall follow handlines until you come to a nice belay ledge below a roof on YSF wall


15 bolts

As good as it sounds

YSF Wall, just after the second fixed rope in the trees, before entering the dank overhanging craggy area with the humongous cedars.
Bolts

Eldred Valley test piece. Above Goodacre take the left bolt line heading towards the long left arching corner crack.  It might be hard to find a downward pulling hold on this mega pitch but it’s all there. Go get it!

Fixed Draw at the last bolt to redirect when cleaning the route. Save a black alien for the top.



Right side of YSF above Beautiful Nightmare and Goodacre


7 bolts + double rack from 00 C3 to #1 C4 plus a black alien for the top traverse.

This Extension to Unprotected Sex  climbs a cruxy series of sidepulls to reach a black streak on the wall follow the streak until you come to a ledge then climb left back onto the white face.

Can be broken up into two pitches or climbed from the ground as one mega 45m pitch.

Unprotected Sex with Multiple Partners



Same as Unprotected Sex

Bolts

YSF Wall Access Spring 2021: Access to the YSF Wall & Cougar's Den is restricted until the end of June 2021. Route development occurring on the lower YSF Wall throughout the months of May and June 2021 will temporarily restrict climber's access to the YSF Wall. The climbing community appreciates visiting climber's patience as we develop many new lines that should be finished by July/August 2021. 

The Buttress is one of the Eldred Valley's most under-appreciated chunks of rock. One of the only walls that hold the potential for many 5.10-11 multi-pitch routes. The wall has many slabby corner systems which lead to a steep headwall. Cleaner than many other walls, and stays in the shade until 12pm in mid-summer.
